text: Twisted Seer of the Wastes
The master of betrayal, guile and treachery leads his Dolgan Tribe in to realms unknown.
Few dare to attempt trickery and deceit when faced with various Chaos Gods, yet Sayl masterfully attempts to decieve them.
The Faithless
Merges with the very essence of Chaos, enhancing strength and resilience. Sayl becomes a conduit for unrestrained power.
Chaos Infusion
Ethereal entities born from the chaotic maelstrom. These creatures serve Sayl in battle, embodying the essence of unpredictability.
Ephemeral Conjuration
Strengthens the bonds with allies who share the faith in Chaos Undivided. Sayl's presence unifies the disparate forces, creating a formidable, chaotic alliance.
Deceit and Treachery
Distorted Echoes
Commands the raw power of Chaos-infused Mammoths, unleashing them upon the battlefield. Sayl rides the tide of colossal fury.
Manipulates time and space, creating echoes of chaos. Sayl's presence becomes disorienting, disrupting enemy coordination.
Mammoth's Wrath Unleashed
Placeholder Text Placeholder Text Placeholder Text Placeholder Text
The Dolgan Tribe
Harnesses the chaotic energies of the Warp to amplify spells. Sayl's magical prowess becomes an unpredictable force, defying conventional counters.
Warp Conduit Mastery
Legendary Lord
Ability: "Traitor’s Mist''
Ability: "Summon Nightmaw''
The Ultimate Deceit
I wonder how you will bargain your way out of this one, Sayl..
Defeated Sayl the Faithless

Twisted and serpentine, the Viperous Staff is the malevolent artifact wielded by Sayl the Faithless. Its dark coils writhe with venomous enchantments, embodying the treacherous essence of its master. Crafted in the shadows of forbidden sorceries, the staff is both a conduit and a weapon, its bite carrying the deadly poison of chaos. In Sayl's hands, the Viperous Staff becomes an instrument of damnation, striking with the insidious force that befits a servant of the ever-shifting tides of Chaos.
Viperous Staff
Sayl the Faithless
Nightmaw
the Faithless
Sayl
Sayl is an utterly self-serving egotist, expert sorcerer and practiced murderer. His road to power lies in his total mastery of betrayal, guile and treachery.
A hellspawn with three ghastly faces enslaved to the will of Sayl. This creature is some form of shadow-kin as it bleeds darkness and is surrounded by a swirling vortex of dark and shadowed forms
Sayl can transform his armoured warriors into intangible mist, allowing them to drift unhindered through the enemy’s battlelines.
Traitor’s Mist
Nightmaw
Using chaotic magic Sayl betrayed nine wizards and bound them together, forming a disfigured monstrosity destined to serve Sayl: Nightmaw.
Spawns Nightmaw at the start of the battle
The staff is entwined with serpents which come alive at Sayl's command, venom dripping from their fangs as they strike with speed and power to defend their master.
Viperous Staff
Ability: "Viperous Staff"

This corpse-skin bag contains numerous, sigil-etched teeth and fangs Sayl has torn from the skulls of the various wizards he has defeated in his unholy career, not least of all those of his first master, Schalkain. Should his magic go awry, Sayl may hurl a handful of the teeth as part of a treacherous curse against an ally to divert the wrath of the Winds of Magic.
Schalkain's Teeth
The Faithless

Sayl's paranoia and hubris that he has never himself sworn allegiance to any single Ruinous Power, but rather paid lip service to many, and pursued pacts and bargains with many petty Chaos godlings and Daemons, betraying each in turn when expedient, earning him the epithet of "the Faithless."
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Marauder Chariot
Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.
War Mammoth
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

Perform the ritual to trick the Cods and gain access to powerful Chosen units. The rewards you recieve will increase if your favour to any God is higher than 10.
Sayl's Ritual
Khorne
Khorne
Tzeentch
Tzeentch
Nurgle
Nurgle
Slaanesh
Slaanesh

In an effort to trick the Chaos Gods themselves, Sayl barters his earned favour to decieve any of the four Chaos Gods in to sending powerful Chosen units his way upon the false promise of dedicating his might to that Chaos God.
Sayl's Trickery
Trickster: Sayl tricks even the Chaos Gods by bartering earned favour for powerful mortal marked units

Allegiance to the Eagle: %+n per turn

Allegiance to the Serpent: %+n per turn
Promises of Blood
As Sayl barters with the God of Blood and Slaughter he vouches to bring an abundance of skulls.
Skulltaker
Flailing the Skull of Schalkain as proof Sayl is capable of offering even the finest of Skulls to the Blood God he hopes to maintain good standings.
Throne Seeker
As Khorne rests comfortably in the Skullthrone it is apparent Sayl has different ambitions and plans all together.
Festering Plague
With honeyed words Sayl convinces Nurgle to bolster his units, the Chaos God unaware of Sayl's true intentions.
Pox Bearer
Nightmaw alone is all the proof Sayls need to show he values beauty in rot and mutation.
Rot Tide
Bringer of the tide of an endless rot, Sayl vouches his allegiance to the serpent - or does he?
Indulger of Excess
He who indulges himself in excess is shallow in his ambitions.
Hunter of Brilliance
The perfect mind is a much perfection as the perfect body, let alone the perfect face.
Soporific Musk
Sayl knows how to tempt the Chaos Gods and he knows all too well what he needs to sweeten any deal with Slaanesh: A Soporific Musk.
Pact of the Changer
The hardest of Chaos Gods to trick is Tzeentch, who knows the ways of change and trickery.
From the Book
It is hard to tell if Tzeentch knows Sayl's true ambition and that the Kurgan only plays a part in the Changer's larger plot.
Revel in Magic
Trickery aside, it is apparent Tzeentch respects Sayl's natural capability to bend the winds of magic to his personal gain.

Vortex of Flesh

Schalkain's Teeth

Ability: "The Vile's Skull"
The skull of Schalkain the Vile still oozes with the dark magic used in the daemonic ritual Sayl enacted on him, warping pure magic from his empty eye sockets.
The Vile's Skull
